Interactive Television: A television that allows viewers to interact with the content on the screen, allowing them to make choices and influence the storyline.
Holographic Television: A television that projects images in 3D, creating a more immersive viewing experience.
Virtual Reality Television: A television that allows viewers to enter a virtual world and experience the content in a whole new way.
Augmented Reality Television: A television that overlays digital content on the real world, allowing viewers to see the content in a more interactive way.
Smart Television: A television that is connected to the internet, allowing viewers to access a wide range of online content and features, such as streaming services, social media, and more.
